page.title: 13GLENLUCE GHOSTS
page.content: In Glenluce most people do not believe in ghosts,but we schoolchildren hear most of the stories and when we are telling the tales we sometimes add more bits on. One story is about a well near a caravan park where a girl was said to be pushed down. Every night her hair is supposed to float in the well. I don't know whether to believe this.{DO YOU? Glenluce is also called the{Valley of {Light.}It is said to be the name derived from the Latin{Vallis Lucis given to the area by the{Cistercian {monks}who stayed at the abbey which was founded in{1192. Castle of Park built by the Dalrymple Hay family in the{16th century}was said to have used stones from the abbey in its structure The area is known for being one of the earliest Neolithic{settlements in {Britain.
